security: The document discusses the process of informing a former employee that their name appears in documents being reviewed for public release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. While the subject had no objection to the release of his name, such notifications and discussions about the release of information, could expose internal procedures. Specifically the line ‘SUBJECT WAS IMPRESSED AND GRATEFUL THAT TQHIGHROAD PROVIDED HIM WITH A HEADS UP ON THIS ISSUE’ reveals that TQHIGHROAD is involved in notifying individuals about the release of their information. This could highlight CIA involvement in shaping narratives overseas, potentially harming ongoing operations and damaging the CIA’s reputation.
summary: A cable detailing a meeting between the COS and a former employee (Subject) to inform him that his name appears in documents being reviewed for release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. The Subject expressed no objection to the release, noting his previous public exposure in Costa Rica and appreciation for the notification.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 7, 1997, the Chief of Station (COS) met with a former employee (referred to as Subject and IDEN) to notify him that his name appears in documents undergoing review for release under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. The Subject reviewed the tear line alerting him to this fact, asked clarifying questions based on provided guidance, and ultimately stated he had no objection to his name being released, pointing out his previous high-profile exposure as COS in San Jose in 1971 during a publicized PNG action. He appreciated the advance notice from TQHIGHROAD.
title: Results of Contact with Former Employee Concerning <JFK> <ASSASSINATION>RECORD COLLECTION ACT
